hero.title: Test! Learn!
hero.description: The automated system for training software testers will help you gain real experience in software testing. Practice, find bugs, write reports, tests and improve your testing skills in real-world scenarios!

highlights.title: Highlights
highlights.subtitle: Find out why our product stands out: flexibility, reliability, user-friendly interface, and innovation. Get the opportunity to improve your testing skills through real-life, hands-on tasks.

items.title: A practical approach
items.description: Focus on real tasks without unnecessary complexity - only useful experience and practice.

items.title: Reliability in every test
items.description: Gain access to a stable and durable platform designed for ongoing practice.

items.title: Convenient learning experience
items.description: Master software testing with an intuitive and easy-to-use interface.

items.title: Innovative opportunities
items.description: Practice any type of test at your own time and pace, without being tied to any schedules or requirements.

items.title: Precision in every detail
items.description: Our system is designed to maximise learning efficiency, with every element contributing to your development.

items.title: Adaptable performance
items.description: Our system is highly customizable to meet your specific requirements, enabling you to enhance your testing skills effectively.

about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: Empowering the next generation of testing professionals

whoWeAre.title: Who We Are
whoWeAre.description: A community of aspiring testers, collaborating to gain practical experience and improve their skills through real-world projects.

whatWeDo.title: What We Do
whatWeDo.description: We provide a platform for beginners to share their projects and collaborate with others, gaining hands-on experience in software testing.

ourVision.title: Our Vision
ourVision.description: To create the largest platform where beginners can learn and grow through real-world testing opportunities, building a solid foundation for their careers.

logoCollection.title: Companies where you can get a job after gaining experience

testimonials.title: Testimonials
testimonials.subtitle: Find out why users choose our system for educational and practical software testing. Evaluate the effectiveness, reliability and convenience of the platform. Join us for quality training, innovative solutions, and comprehensive support.
testimonials.loadError: Failed to load testimonials. Please try again later.

questions.question: How can I upload my project to the platform?
questions.answer: To upload your project, simply log in to your account with the «Mentor» role, go to the «Projects» section and follow the steps to create your project!

questions.question: How can I test the projects shared by others?
questions.answer: First, you should go to the «Projects» tab. Then click on a project to start testing and follow the instructions provided by the project owner.

questions.question: Can I provide feedback on a project I've tested?
questions.answer: Yes, when testing a project, you can leave feedback by rating the project and leaving comments. This helps both project authors and other testers to improve their work.

questions.question: Is there a limit to the number of projects I can test?
questions.answer: There is no limit! You can test as many projects as you like and gain experience from various domains. The more projects you test, the more you learn.

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.description: We strive to provide effective solutions for hands-on software testing, helping users around the world to improve their skills.

helpAndSupport.title: Frequently Asked Questions
helpAndSupport.contactInfo: If you have further questions, please contact us at

projectCreation.question: How do I create a new project?
projectCreation.answer: To create a new project, navigate to the Projects section in the main menu, click the 'Create New' button, and fill in the required fields including title, description, instructions, and GitHub link. You can also attach relevant files to your project.

projectCreation.question: What information is required to set up a project?
projectCreation.answer: To set up a project, you need to provide a title, project description (optional), instructions for testers (optional), and a GitHub repository link. Files can be added after the project is created.

projectCreation.question: Can I change the project status after creation?
projectCreation.answer: Yes, you can change the project status to 'Active', 'Inactive', or 'Paused' at any time by going to the project details and selecting the edit option from the settings menu.

bugReporting.question: How do I create a bug report?
bugReporting.answer: To create a bug report, navigate to the relevant project, then click 'Create Bug Report'. Fill out the form with a detailed description of the issue, including steps to reproduce, screenshots, and environment information.

bugReporting.question: How can I update the status of a bug report?
bugReporting.answer: Project owners or administrators can update bug report statuses. Open the specific bug report and select the 'Edit' option from the settings menu. In the form, you can change the status to 'Opened', 'In Progress', 'Resolved', or 'Closed'.

bugReporting.question: What do the different bug severity levels mean?
bugReporting.answer: We use 4 severity levels: 'Low' for minor issues that don't impact functionality; 'Medium' for issues that cause inconvenience but don't block work; 'High' for issues that seriously disrupt functionality; and 'Critical' for issues that completely block system operation or cause data loss.

projectManagement.question: How do I add test cases to a project?
projectManagement.answer: Navigate to the project details and in the 'Test Cases' tab, click 'Create New'. Fill out the required fields including preconditions, test steps, and input data. Test cases can also be created via the main 'Test Cases' menu.

projectManagement.question: How can I attach files to a project?
projectManagement.answer: On the project details page, navigate to the 'Attachments' tab. There you'll see an 'Upload File' button that allows you to attach relevant files. Various file formats are supported, including images, documents, and archives.

projectManagement.question: Can I delete a project?
projectManagement.answer: Yes, the project owner or an administrator can delete a project. Navigate to the project details, open the settings menu, and select 'Delete'. Be careful as this action is irreversible and will remove all associated data.

accountManagement.question: How do I change my password?
accountManagement.answer: To change your password, go to your Profile page, select the 'Change Password' tab, enter your current password and your new password, then confirm the change.

accountManagement.question: How can I update my personal information?
accountManagement.answer: Go to your Profile page where you can edit your personal details, including your first and last name. After making changes, click 'Save Changes'.

accountManagement.question: What does the user rating mean?
accountManagement.answer: The user rating reflects your contribution and activity on the platform. You earn points for creating tests, test cases, bug reports, as well as through ratings from other users for the quality of your work.
